"Challenge Blocks"

"This explains Challenge Blocks.

Challenge Blocks are blocks where you can take Challenge Quests.

In Challenge Blocks, players' levels and equipment are temporarily restricted so that training can take place in a controlled environment.

Some other functions such as Client Orders and Matter Boards have also been restricted, but rest assured that they will return to normal when you return to a normal block."

"In Challenge Blocks, just like normal blocks, quests can be taken from the Quest Counter.

You can use the Teleporter to move to another Challenge Block, or to return to your original block."

"We will now explain the Challenge Monument.

By accessing the Challenge Monument in a Challenge Block, you can view the Challenge Quest rankings.

Take on a Challenge Quest and aim to be number 1.

※Rankings are reset regularly"
"Challenge Quests"

"This will explain Challenge Quests.

The aim of a Challenge Quest is to complete a specific mission before VR Energy expires.

The quest ends under either of the following conditions:
・The specified mission is completed
・VR Energy expires

VR Energy is shared among all participants. The amount remaining is displayed as a green bar."

"We will now explain Challenger.

In Challenge Quests, your class is set to Challenger.

Challenger has the following features:
・Can equip all weapons and armor
・Can learn and equip all PAs, Techniques and Skills from disks

Up to 2 Stances can be used at once.
※Some stances cannot be used together"

"We will now explain VR Energy.

VR Energy is essentially a time limit on the quest.

VR Energy is consumed under the following conditions:
・Time passes during the quest
・A player is unable to fight

VR Energy can be recovered by picking up energy capsules.
Energy picked up is shared among all particpants.
※※There are some capsules that aren't displayed on the minimap."

"When a player is unable to battle, a significant amount of VR Energy is consumed.

The consumed energy can be recovered if the player is revived by the following method:
・Use a Moon Atomizer

When revived by any other method, VR energy does not recover, so try to revive your friends as much as possible.

Also, if the defeated player has a Challenge Doll, they will automatically revive without consuming VR Energy."

"We will now explain the Interval Area.

During the quest, there are break points called Interval Areas.
When a player reaches this area, VR consumption over time pauses.
※Energy will still be consumed when a player is unable to battle and recovered when a Moon Atomizer is used

In addition, all players who have not reached this area after a certain time will be forcibly transferred.
Defeated players will be revived, but VR Energy will not recover."

"In the Interval Area, you can use the Recycle Shop to exchange items for other items that are more useful to you.

Replenish your recovery items for the next mission and exchange weapons and disks.

If you don't have enough exchange items, you may be able to get them from your party members."

"We will now explain Challenge Miles.

You can get Challenge Miles from finishing a Challenge Quest. Challenge Miles can be exchanged for various items in the Shop Area.

Miles can mainly be earned by the following methods:
・Clearing a mission
・Getting Mile Crystals
The mission clearance rate is determined by the position of the frontmost player. Also, the amount acquired from Mile Crystals is shared among all participants."

"We will now explain the Personal Best Tag.

After you finish a Challenge Quest, your Personal Best Tag will be present the next time you play the quest.

This indicates your current clearance record, and will update as you break your record.

Your record is blue. The records of other players are silver."

"In Challenge Quests, items dropped by enemies or that come from containers can only be picked up by you.

Other players cannot pick them up, so be sure to collect any items that appear."

"We will now explain the Extra Charge Bonus.

When recovering VR Energy to over 100%, you can get an Extra Charge Bonus depending on the amount recovered.

The Extra Charge Bonus awards 1 Challenge Mile for every 2.5% recovered, but VR Energy will never go beyond 100%, so be aware of the time limit."
"The Shared Ship"

"This explains the Shared Ship.

The Shared Ship is a place where you can interact with other players beyond the normal boundaries of your Ship. Within this Ship, you can play Challenge Quests and Battle Arena Matches with players from other Ships.

You can travel to their respective lobbies by selecting \"Go to Shared Ship Battle Lobby\" or \"Go to Shared Ship Challenge Lobby\" from the Teleporter."
